context.goal: Tidy the workspace so future extractor work starts from a clean, well-documented layout.
current_state: Multiple demo Streamlit scripts sit in the repo root alongside primary entry points.
Design docs (PRD/ADR) now live under docs/, but README does not reference them.
docs/ directory lacks an index that explains available and planned documents.
No consistent location for saving test reports that future agents can review.

tasks.description: Create an examples/ directory and relocate the non-primary Streamlit demo scripts into it.
steps: Create examples/ at the repo root if it does not exist.
Move demo_legal_events.py, simple_process_app.py, simple_legal_table_app.py, guaranteed_table_app.py, and legal_events_app.py into examples/.
Update any relative imports or instructions that assume these files live in the root (search README, CLAUDE.md, or scripts/).

tasks.description: Add a concise 'Repo Map' section to README.md that highlights key components including the new docs.
steps: Insert the section near the existing project structure or overview.
List primary directories (src/, tests/, examples/, docs/) and describe their purpose in one line each.
Link to docs/pluggable_extractors_prd.md and docs/adr/ADR-001-pluggable-extractors.md so new contributors can find them quickly.

tasks.description: Create docs/README.md summarizing design and reference materials.
steps: Introduce the purpose of docs/ and list current documents with short descriptions.
Add a 'Planned/Upcoming Docs' checklist for items like provider matrix, troubleshooting, or runbooks.
Ensure links are relative and work from the docs/ directory.

tasks.description: Run the agreed test suite and save the resulting report somewhere future agents can reach it.
steps: Execute the designated smoke or regression tests after housekeeping changes.
Store any generated reports or logs under docs/reports/ (create the directory if needed).
Include a note in the summary pointing to the saved report path.
Run `git status -sb` to confirm the only changes are the intended moves/edits.
Open the Streamlit run instructions to ensure examples/ paths are accurate.
Note any follow-up needed (e.g., if downstream tooling still references old paths).

acceptance_criteria: examples/ contains all moved demo scripts, and running instructions point to the new locations.
README.md includes a clear Repo Map section with working relative links to the PRD and ADR.
docs/README.md exists with summaries of current docs and a checklist of planned additions.
Completed test reports are stored under docs/reports/ (or another documented path) and referenced in the work summary.
`git status` shows only the expected file moves and edits, with no accidental deletions or unrelated changes recorded.
notes: Do not refactor application logic; keep this pass focused on organization, documentation, and test-report retention.
